security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate documentation and guidance skill for building MCP servers. All 600 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - patterns detected in markdown documentation are misinterpreted as security risks. The Python scripts (evaluation.py, connections.py) form a standard MCP evaluation harness that uses the official MCP library for subprocess communication and Anthropic SDK for API calls.

content.user_title: Build MCP servers for LLM tool integration
content.value_statement: Creating effective MCP servers requires understanding agent-centric design, proper tool definitions, and evaluation strategies. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for building production-ready MCP servers in Python or TypeScript.
actual_capabilities: Guide MCP server architecture and project structure setup
Create tool definitions with input validation using Pydantic or Zod
Implement multiple transport options (stdio, HTTP, SSE)
Build evaluation frameworks to test MCP server effectiveness
Apply security best practices for API authentication
Design response formats optimized for LLM context efficiency
limitations: Does not provide pre-built MCP servers for specific services
Does not execute MCP servers or make actual API calls to external services
Does not include authentication credentials or access tokens
Does not deploy or host MCP servers on remote infrastructure

prompt_templates.title: Build a GitHub MCP
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an MCP server for the GitHub API using Python and FastMCP. Include tools for listing repositories, creating issues, and searching code.

prompt_templates.title: Add authentication
prompt_templates.prompt: Add OAuth 2.1 authentication to an existing MCP server. Use environment variables for API keys.

prompt_templates.title: Create evaluations
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an evaluation framework for an MCP server using the evaluation.py script. Write 10 complex questions.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize for production
prompt_templates.prompt: Review an existing MCP server implementation and optimize it for production with pagination, character limits, and HTTP transport.

output_examples.input: Build an MCP server for a task management API with tools to list tasks, create tasks, and update task status.
output: Uses FastMCP Python SDK with Pydantic models for validation
Supports JSON and Markdown response formats

best_practices: Design tools for complete workflows, not just individual API endpoints. Consolidate related operations into cohesive tools.
Use input validation with Pydantic or Zod to ensure data integrity with descriptive field constraints.
Implement pagination and character limits to prevent overwhelming LLM context windows.
anti_patterns: Avoid simply wrapping existing API endpoints as individual tools. This creates tool sprawl.
Do not return exhaustive data dumps without truncation. Optimize responses for information density.
Avoid generic tool names without service prefixes. Use clear naming like github_create_issue.

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Python using FastMCP SDK and TypeScript using MCP TypeScript SDK are fully supported.

faq.question: What transport options are available?
faq.answer: Three transport types: stdio for local subprocess, HTTP for web services, and SSE for real-time updates.

faq.question: How do I authenticate MCP servers?
faq.answer: Store API keys in environment variables. Implement OAuth 2.1 for external services with proper token validation.

faq.question: Is data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: MCP servers you build will make network calls to the services they integrate. Evaluation scripts call Anthropic API for testing.

faq.question: How do I test if my MCP server works?
faq.answer: Use the evaluation.py script to run test questions against your server. Create 10 complex questions requiring multiple tool calls.

faq.question: How does MCP compare to custom tools?
faq.answer: MCP provides a standardized protocol for tool discovery, invocation, and data formatting across different LLM clients.
